title: Calligraphic Resources
content:
Hi Everyone

I am investigating calligraphic styles, especially contemporary adaptations of the traditional hand drawn styles.

I have built up a nice collection of examples, but I have this one (attached) that I need more on. It is a very popular style at the momennt.

I am looking for more good examples and information on this style specifically

Any help would be appriciated.

Gustav

author: Stavros Elegarmond

comments.content: Jessica Hische is an amazing illustrator for this style.

I'd recommend that you look into the amazing lettering work of [Seb Lester on Flickr](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201085942/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/42591863@N00/) or on [his own site](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201085942/http:/www.seblester.co.uk/type_lettering.php?PageNumber=2). His [typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201085942/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/SearchPage.htm?kid=sebastian%20lester) are amazing too.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201085942im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SL_4391.jpg)

Who is your sample by? [Si Scott](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201085942/http:/www.art-dept.com/illustration/scott/) also does work with similar spiraling swashes, although his hand-lettering is more type-based than calligraphic.
